ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about the period of history Lucan was writing in (Nero!) and the time he was writing about. The Bellum Civile is a really fun and interesting work to read, and we looked at a lot of different perspectives on it as well as generating some of our own.
Reading and interpreting complex syntax, studying literature critically and diachronically.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Prof Kraus is a gem. The poem is really fun, and basically the opposite of boring. Weekly quizzes were great for reviewing and improving my Latin and also took pressure off us (I liked them better than a big midterm test). I liked that we did some of the readings in English to get a broader view of the poem as well. Weaknesses: Class discussion often wandered a little far afield into areas that just a couple people in the class were familiar with, which just made it harder to follow for everyone else, so class time was sometimes less enjoyable. Also, the length of Latin readings increased dramatically throughout the semester (from 50-60 lines to 110 lines), which piled up a lot of stress for me at the end.
It was extremely well-organized. The readings were always pertinent and very interesting. We could have, perhaps, lingered on the language a bit more given its complexity

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This is a great Latin class to take. Lucan is difficult, but very fun, and Professor Kraus will help you get through it all.
Definitely! Lucan is more important than you think!
